description: Metrics useful for benchmarking and loadtesting Prometheus itself. Designed primarily for Prometheus 3.x.

panels.description:
Delta of number of bytes allocated per second (go_memstats_alloc_bytes_total), even if freed. PR minus Reference, so negative values indicate how much less PR allocates.

10m lower than our periodic scrape load scale ups and downs cycles (~30m interval) but large enough to hide noise.
panels.title: rate[10m] Go Heap Allocations (PR vs Ref: smaller, ideally negative, is better)

panels.description: Ref % of Delta of number of bytes allocated per second (go_memstats_alloc_bytes_total), even if freed. PR minus Reference, so negative values indicate how much less PR allocates.

Delta of number of avg bytes allocated within 30m windows for RSS and heap.

PR minus Reference, so negative values indicate how much less PR allocates.
panels.title: avg[10m] Allocations (PR vs Ref: smaller, ideally negative, is better)

panels.description:
Ref % of Delta of number of avg bytes allocated within 30m windows for RSS and heap.

PR minus Reference, so negative values indicate how much less PR allocates.

Delta of per second process CPU usage.

PR minus Reference, so negative values indicate how much less the PR use CPU.
panels.title: rate[10m] CPU (PR vs Ref: smaller, ideally negative, is better)

panels.description:
Ref % of Delta of per second process CPU usage.

PR minus Reference, so negative values indicate how much less the PR use CPU.

panels.title: rate[10m] Query Instant Latency (PR vs Ref: smaller, ideally negative, is better)

panels.description:
Ref % of Delta of Query instant latency

PR minus Reference, so negative values indicate how much less the PR use CPU.

panels.title: rate[10m] Query Range Latency (PR vs Ref: smaller, ideally negative, is better)

panels.description:
Ref % of Delta of Query range latency

PR minus Reference, so negative values indicate how much less the PR use CPU.
This graph shows the sample ingested per second
panels.title: Samples Appended/s

panels.description: This graph indicates how many time series each instance holds
panels.title: Head Time series

panels.description: This graph shows the total number of times the database reloaded block data from disk
panels.title: TSDB Reloads/s

panels.description: Total Number of currently loaded data blocks
panels.title: Blocks Loaded

panels.description: This graph shows various tsdb related checks
panels.title: TSDB Problems/s

panels.description: Total number of compactions that were executed for the partition
panels.title: Compactions/s

panels.description: Step 61s is to avoid aliasing (max interval of our queries is 1m)
panels.title: HTTP requests/s

panels.description: Total number of bytes allocated, even if freed
panels.title: Allocations

panels.description: Total number of objects allocated
panels.title: Objects allocated per second

panels.description: Average compactions that were executed for the partition
panels.title: Avg Compaction Time/s

panels.description: WAL is used to get the backup when the prometheus server crashes. WAL stores the last 2hrs of data in memory. After that it has to truncate the data. So, this graph shows the latency of truncation
panels.title: WAL Truncate Latency

panels.description: Disk space used of all filesystems mounted
panels.title: Disk Space Used Basic

panels.description: Time spent in queue_time mode, per second
panels.title: Avg query engine timings/s - queue_time

panels.description: Average Time spent in inner_eval mode, per second
panels.title: Avg query engine timings/s - inner_eval

panels.description: Average Time spent in result_sort mode, per second
panels.title: Avg query engine timings/s - result_sort

panels.description: Time spent in prepare_time mode, per second
panels.title: Avg query engine timings/s - prepare_time

panels.description: Total number open and maximum file descriptors of both release and PR
panels.title: File Descriptors

panels.description: Chunks are the collection of series of samples. The active series is known as the head chunk. Total of 120 samples are present in a chunk. This graph shows the total head chunks
panels.title: Head Chunks

panels.description: Average runtime of garbage collection in the head block
panels.title: Avg Head GC Time/s

panels.description: Plots of minimum and maximum timestamp of the head block in reference to current time
panels.title: Head Time Range

panels.description: This graph shows the total number of active appender transactions
panels.title: Head Active Appenders

panels.description:
Rule group describe the Prometheus alerts. These graph consist of two rules:
- prometheus_rule_group_interval_seconds:  When the first notification was sent, wait for 'group_interval' to send a batch of new alerts that started firing for that group.
- prometheus_rule_group_last_duration_seconds: It shows the last duration of each one of your groups in seconds
panels.title: Rule Group: $RuleGroup

panels.description: Total number of times the database cut off block data from disk
panels.title: Retention Cutoffs/s
First Compaction, Avg Chunk Time Range

panels.description: This graph shows the highest and lowest TSDB watermarks. The highest watermark represents the latest appender and the lowest watermark represents the oldest appender
panels.title: TSDB Isolation Watermarks

panels.description: Head chunk is converted to chunk when it is filled with 120 samples. This graph shows the total number of head chunks created
panels.title: Head Chunks Removed

panels.description: This graph the difference of highest and lowest of TSDB watermark and also shows the size of isolation linked-chain
panels.title: TSDB Isolation Watermarks Difference

panels.description: This graph shows chunks created per second
panels.title: Head Chunks Created

panels.description: The latency distributions of fsync called by wal. High fsync duration (fsync_durations_seconds) indicates disk issues and might cause the cluster to be unstable
panels.title: WAL Fsync Latency
Attic: Old panels, likely to remove

title: Prombench
